sentence.text: Mutations in the glutaminyl-tRNA synthetase (prolyl-tRNA aminoacylation) gene have been reported in patients with progressive microcephaly, cerebral-cerebellar atrophy, and intractable seizures.

The clinical presentation of our patients differs from the original prolyl-tRNA aminoacylation-associated syndrome in the severe postnatal growth failure, absence of epilepsy, and minor MRI findings, thus further expanding the phenotypic spectrum of the glutaminyl-tRNA synthetase deficiency syndromes
